contextId.information: These three phrases indicate comparisons to show what they have in common. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: walk about like blind men ... poured out like dust ... their inner parts like dung

contextId.information: The chaff is the insignificant part of the plant being thrown away and so this day will pass quickly. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]]).
contextId.quote: that day passes like the chaff
